title: Geometric Sans found on mid-60's British amplifier
content:
It's similar to Johnston, but some details are way off. Check out the "S" and the flat topped "4".

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803175305im_/http:/typophile.com/files/13_f_4587.jpg)

More samples:  
 [http://img1.jpegbay.com/gallery/003087932/11\_f.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803175305/http:/img1.jpegbay.com/gallery/003087932/11_f.jpg)  
 [http://img1.jpegbay.com/gallery/003087932/12\_f.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803175305/http:/img1.jpegbay.com/gallery/003087932/12_f.jpg)

Anyone know this one?
author: Font-A-Saurus

comments.content:
I can't find an exact match (especially one having a short /J) but you may like one of the following alternatives:  
 **[Underground](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803175305/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Nick-Curtis&ffam=Underground%20-%20Normal&fid=424628f976863e544974536769120e60&fsize=48&text=NORMAL%20INPUTS%20JTM%2045%20LOUDNESS%202%20HIGH%20TREBLE&wrap=2)** by Nick Curtis [1999]  
 **[Gill Sans Demi Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803175305/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Monotype&ffam=Gill%20Sans%20Hel-Demi%20-%20Regular&fid=22b0e9da5b5e179c4a8f099a0fdf8117&fsize=60&text=NORMAL%20INPUTS%20JTM%2045%20LOUDNESS%202%20HIGH%20TREBLE&wrap=2)**  
 **[Chantilly](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803175305/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=URW&ffam=Chantilly%20-%20Regular&fid=eddce42f570df0d760a81ce2dc6672e1&fsize=60&text=NORMAL%20INPUTS%20JTM%2045%20LOUDNESS%202%20HIGH%20TREBLE&wrap=2)** by URW & SoftMaker [1992]

Thanks!  
There is quite a number of similar types, indeed. Yet Johnson seems to be the closest match so far.

I'd really like to find that exact font.
